thread.title: Cleveland Browns uniform tracker: Multicolor vs. monochromatic on Sunday
thread.title_full: Cleveland Browns uniform tracker: Multicolor vs. monochromatic on Sunday | cleveland.com

author: Joey Morona, Northeast Ohio Media Group
title: Cleveland Browns uniform tracker: Multicolor vs. monochromatic on Sunday
text:
CLEVELAND, Ohio -- It will be multicolor vs. monochromatic on Sunday when the Browns travel to Baltimore for a game with the Ravens.
For the first time this season, the Browns will be wearing three colors at the same time: white jerseys, brown pants and orange socks . In contrast, the Ravens will be wearing just one color: black jerseys, black pants and black socks, though they'll have pink accents in honor of Breast Cancer Awareness Month.
The Browns have worn their new brown trousers three times (twice in preseason, once in the regular season), but paired them with brown socks until now.
The Ravens' alternate black jerseys, worn twice a year, are somewhat of a good luck charm for them. The Ravens are 13-5 in black .
The Browns have still not worn their new orange jerseys yet, though next week's home game against Denver would be a good opportunity to break them out. After all, Peyton Manning is used to throwing passes to players in orange jerseys. ðŸ˜‰
Time to unveil the uniform combo for #CLEvsBAL...White | Brown | OrangeCheck out all the possible future combos HERE >> bit.ly/NewBrownsUnis
